```{r, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

# Learning to reference figures{#figures}
```{r FigRef, fig.cap="This is radom noise."}
x = seq(1:100)
y = rnorm(100)
dat = data.frame(x, y)
ggplot(dat, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_line()
```
In Figure \@ref(fig:FigRef), we plot x vs y as line plot.

# Learning to refernce table {#tables}

```{r TabRef}
knitr::kable(head(dat, n=5), caption = "This is the first 5 rows")
```

In Table \@ref(tab:TabRef), we show the first 5 rows of the table.

# Conclusions

In Section \@ref(figures), we learn how to reference figures. while in Section \@ref(tables), we learn how to reference tables.
